abstract: United Nations Human Rights Council report reveals that at least 966 people had been executed in Iran in 2015, highest number in over 25 years, mostly for drug-related offenses.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Iran: 966 Were Executed in 2015
headline.main: Iran Executions at Highest Level Since ’89

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

snippet: At least 966 people were put to death in Iran last year, according to a special investigator’s report to the United Nations Human Rights Council.
lead_paragraph: At least 966 people were put to death in Iran last year, according to a special investigator’s report to the United Nations Human Rights Council.
